Hi,
     Thanks for your suggestions. They are indeed
helpful. Actually i am working in an architecture
where the GUI is made out of parsing XML Files using a
parser. After running the client the main class of
that parser takes xml file as argument and parses it
to pop up GUI. There are action listeners classes
attached to every Frame. The code is already written
for all this now i want to implement JUnit FrameWork
to test these action listeners. 
now i have 2 questions
1. What are disadvantages of implementing JUnit
Framework in already existing code.
2. Is it required to test the GUI like a particular
frame exists or not  or a particular swing component
exist in frame or not. We can just test whether the
particular screen does the job it is supposed to do.
Like sending requests to server etc

Regards
Arvind
